definitions.definition: ( law , banking , finance ) An act or instance of lending , an act or instance of granting something for temporary use.
examples: Because of the loan that John made to me, I was able to pay my tuition for the upcoming semester.

definitions.definition: ( law , banking , finance ) A sum of money or other property that a natural or legal person borrows from another with the condition that it be returned or repaid over time or at a later date (sometimes with interest ).
examples: All loans from the library, whether books or audio material, must be returned within two weeks.
He got a loan of five thousand pounds.

definitions.definition: The contract and array of legal or ethical obligations surrounding a loan.
examples: He made a payment on his loan .

definitions.definition: The permission to borrow any item.
examples: Thank you for the loan of your lawn mower.

main_definition: ( law , banking , finance ) An act or instance of lending , an act or instance of granting something for temporary use.
secondary_definitions: ( law , banking , finance ) A sum of money or other property that a natural or legal person borrows from another with the condition that it be returned or repaid over time or at a later date (sometimes with interest ).
The contract and array of legal or ethical obligations surrounding a loan.
The permission to borrow any item.

definitions.definition: An area of uncultivated ground near a village or farmhouse.

main_definition: ( Scotland , Northern England ) An area of uncultivated ground near a village or farmhouse.
